gurmukhi: cMdn ijau quih AMg mlXo iqh qy hmhUM jdubIr irJwXo ] joaU mnorQ Qo ijX mY qumry imley soaU mo kir AwXo ]994]
transliteration: Channdan Jio Tuhe An Malyo Tih Te Hamhoon Jadoubeer Rijhaayo|| Jooo Manorath Tho Jiya Mai Toumre Milae Sooo Mo Kar(i) Aayo||994||
translation: “I have rubbed the sandal on my limbs for thy sake, O the hero of Yadavas, for your pleasure and now on meeting you, I have attained the objective of my mind.”994.

gurmukhi: ieiq sRI bicqR nwtk gRMQy kubjw ky giH jw mnorQ pUrn smwpqM ]
transliteration: It(i) Sribachaitra Naatak Granthe Koubjaa Ke Graih Jaa Manorath Paaran Samaaptan||
translation: End of the description of “Fulfilling the objective of Kubja on going to her house” in Bachittar Natak.

gurmukhi: AQ AkrUr ky Dwm kwnH jU Awey ]
transliteration: Ath Akroor Ke Dhaam Kaahn Joo Aae||
translation: Now begins the description of Krishna’s visit to the house of Akrur

gurmukhi: dY suK mwln kau Aiq hI AkRUrih ky iPr Dwm pDwrXo ] Awvq so sun pwie lgXo iqh m`iD clXo hir pRym icqwrXo ]
transliteration: Dai Soukh Maalan Kau At(i) Hiakroorah(i) Ke Phir Dhaam Padhdaryo|| Oovat So Soun Paae Lagyo Tih Maddh(i) Chadyo Har(i) Prem Chitdaryo||
translation: After imparting pleasure to Kubja, then Krishna went to the house of Akrur hearing about his arrival, he came to fall at his feet;

gurmukhi: so gih sXwm ky pwie rhXo kib ny suK qy ieh BwNq aucwrXo ] aUDv so jdubIr khXo ien sMqn ko Aiq pRym inhwrXo ]995]
transliteration: So Gadh Syaam Ke Paae Rahyo Kabi Ne Moukh Te Eh Bhaant Ouchdaryo|| Oodhav So Jadoubeer Kahyo In Santan Ko At(i) Prem Nihrdaryo||995||
translation: When he was lying at the feet of Krishna, seeing him, he said to Udhava, “The love of the saints of this type is also profound, I have felt it.”995.

gurmukhi: aUDv sXwm khXo sun kY AkRUrih ko Aiq pRym inhwrXo ] su`D krI aun kI mn mY kubjw ko khXo Aru pRym icqwrXo ]
transliteration: Oodhav Syaam Kahyo Soun Kai Akroorah(i) Ko At(i) Prem Nihdaryo|| Suddh Karioun Kiman Mai Koubjaa Ko Kahyo Ar(u) Prem Chitdaryo||
translation: Krishna said to Udhava, “Seeing the love of Akrur, I have become conscious of the love of Kubja;”

gurmukhi: so gnqI kir kY mn mY knHXw sMg pY ieh BwNq aucwrXo ] hy hir jU ieh ky ipKey aun ko sB pRym ibdw kir fwrXo ]996]
transliteration: So Gadtikar(i) Kai Man Mai Kanhyaa San Pai Eh Bhaant Ouchdaryo|| He Har(i) Joo Eh Ke Pikhae Oun Ko Sabh Prem Bidaa Kar(i) Ddaryo||996
translation: Seeing this and reflecting on this Udhava said, “He is exhibiting so much love, before which the love of Kubja is insignificant.”996.

gurmukhi: hir rUp inhwr mnY suK pwie pwie kY sRI jdubIr kI syv su kInI ] pwie pro qih ky bhuro auT dyvkI lwl pirkRmw dInI ]
transliteration: Har(i) Roop Nihaar Manai Soukh Paaekai Srijadoubeer Kisev Su Keenee|| Paae Daro Tah(i) Ke Bahuro Outh Devakilaal Prikramaa Deenee||
translation: Akrur was highly pleased on seeing the face of Krishna and he absorbed himself in selfless service of Krishna; he touched the feet of Krishna and circumambulated around him;

gurmukhi: Bojn AMn ijqo gH Qo soaU Awn Dro ihq bwq lKInI ] Qo mn mo soaU bwCq ie`Cv hY jsuDw suq pUrn kInI ]997]
transliteration: Bhojan Ann Jito Grah Tho Sooo Aan Hit Baat Lakheenee|| Tho Man Mo Sooo Baachhat Ichchhav Hai Jasudhaa Sout Pooran Keenee||997||
translation: Having been absorbed in great affection, whatever food and victuals etc. were there in the house, he brought them all before Krishna; whatever desire Akrur had in his mind, Krishna, the son of Yashoda fulfilled it.997.

gurmukhi: pUrn kY mnsw iqh kI sMg aUDv lY iPr Dwm AXo ] giH Awie kY mMgn log bulwie gvwvq BXo iqh rwg gXo ]
transliteration: Pooran Kai Mansaa Tih Kisan Oodhav Lai Phir Dhaam Ayo|| Grah(i) Aae Kai Manad Log Bulaae Gvaavat Bhyo Tih Raag Gado||
translation: Fulfilling the desire of Akrur and taking Udhava alongwith him, Krishna returned to his home; on coming home the medicants were called and getting pleased various types of alms were given to them in charity;

gurmukhi: iqn aUpr rIJ khY kib sXwm Gno giH qy kF dwn dXo ] mno qw js qy miRq mMfl mY Ab ky idn lau idn syq BXo ]998]
transliteration: Tin Oopar Reejh Kahai Kahi Syaam Ghano Grah(i) Te Kadh Daan Dayo|| Mano Taa Jas Te Mrit Mandal Mai Ab Ke Din Lau Din Set Dhayo||998||
translation: By this act, there was so much approbation of Krishna, the poet Shyam says that with this praise even uptil this day, the daytime appears white in the sphere of death.998.
